thread.title: Antonio Brown, Steelers agree on five-year contract
thread.title_full: Antonio Brown, Steelers agree on five-year contract

author: Sean Gentille / Pittsburgh Post-Gazette
title: Antonio Brown, Steelers agree on five-year contract
text:
Antonio Brown, Steelers agree on five-year contract February 27, 2017 5:32 PM Peter Diana/Post-Gazette Antonio Brown By Sean Gentille / Pittsburgh Post-Gazette 
The Steelers got their wish: The team and wide receiver Antonio Brown agreed to a contract extension that will make Brown the highest-paid receiver in the league. 
A source told the Post-Gazette’s Ed Bouchette that the contract is for five years and $72.7 million. That puts Brown’s salary at more than $15 million. 
Shortly after the news broke, Brown tweeted a photo of himself with agent Drew Rosenhaus indicating that the deal was signed. — Antonio Brown (@AntonioBrown) February 27, 2017 
Brown, a perennial All-Pro, had one year remaining on a five-year, $42 million contract. General manager Kevin Colbert said on Feb. 16 that ensuring that Brown remained “a Steeler for life” was the team’s top offseason priority. 
Earlier on Monday, the team designated running Le’Veon Bell its exclusive franchise player, guaranteeing that he’d play the 2017 in Pittsburgh. Bell could’ve become an unrestricted free agent on March 9.
